articles.author: Stephanie Van Den Berg
articles.description: The International Court of Justice is holding hearings this week in a case brought by South Africa accusing Israel of genocide in the Gaza war and seeking an emergency halt to its Rafah offensive.
articles.title: Explainer: What is South Africa's genocide case against Israel at the ICJ?

articles.author: Guy Faulconbridge
articles.description: Russian President Vladimir Putin will visit China on Thursday for talks with Xi Jinping that the Kremlin hopes will deepen a strategic partnership between the two most powerful geopolitical rivals of the United States.
articles.title: Putin to visit China's Xi to deepen strategic partnership

articles.author: Ayhan Uyanik, Boldizsar Gyori
articles.description: Slovakia's Prime Minister Robert Fico was in "very serious" but stable condition on Thursday, a hospital official said, after he was shot five times in an assassination attempt that laid bare deep political divisions in the country.
articles.title: Slovak leader Fico stable after surgery but condition 'very serious'

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Ari Rabinovitch
articles.description: Israel's tanks pushed into the heart of Jabalia in northern Gaza on Thursday, facing anti-tank rockets and mortar bombs from militants concentrated there, while in the south, its forces pounded Rafah without advancing, Palestinian residents and militants said.
articles.title: Israel moves in on north Gaza Hamas stronghold, pounds Rafah without advancing

articles.author: Kirsty Needham, Camille Raynaud
articles.description: Armed forces were protecting New Caledonia's two airports and port after a third night of violent riots that have killed four people, the Pacific Island's top French official said on Thursday morning, adding at least four alleged instigators were under house arrest.
articles.title: Hundreds arrested, roads barricaded in New Caledonia as riots continue

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The number of people killed by weekend flash floods and mud slides in Indonesia's West Sumatra province has risen to 67 and 20 are still missing, authorities said on Thursday, as the government plans to relocate survivors to safer areas.
articles.title: Indonesia's death toll rises to 67 from Sumatra floods, 20 still missing

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian forces are preparing to try to take a village called Lyptsi located about 30 km (19 miles) north of Kharkiv, Ukraine's second largest city, according to a Russian-installed official quoted by Russia's RIA state news agency.
articles.title: Russian forces are trying to take Ukrainian village 30km from Kharkiv, says RIA

articles.author: Ali Kucukgocmen
articles.description: Dimitri Chikovani, a member of Georgia’s opposition United National Movement (UNM) and an active protester against a controversial new law said he was attacked by five people last week, blaming the government for seeking to intimidate opponents.
articles.title: Georgian opposition member says government is intimidating protesters

articles.author: Asif Shahzad
articles.description: Pakistan's former Prime Minister Imran Khan appeared before the Supreme Court by video link from prison on Thursday to plead his petition against changes in Pakistan's anti-graft laws.
articles.title: Jailed Pakistan ex-PM Imran Khan appears in top court by video link

articles.author: Jonathan Landay, Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United States aims to have a floating pier in place off the Gaza Strip coast in the coming days to boost aid deliveries, but Washington is facing the same challenges that have beset the United Nations and relief groups for months when it comes to distributing assistance to the war-torn enclave.
articles.title: US aid pier for Gaza floats into wartime reality
